questions.question_text: Where is stopping strictly prohibited, regardless of the circumstances?

options.a: On narrow sections of the road and at blind spots.
options.b: On the hard shoulder of a highway.

questions.explanation: According to the rules, stopping is prohibited on narrow sections of the road and at blind spots as it creates a significant hazard.

questions.question_text: What is the legal definition of being 'parked'?

options.a: Stopping for more than 1 minute without switching off the engine.
options.b: Anyone who stops for more than 3 minutes or who leaves their vehicle.
options.c: Leaving the vehicle for any amount of time, even if the engine is running.

questions.explanation: A driver is considered to be parking if they stop for more than 3 minutes or if they leave the vehicle.

questions.question_text: What is the minimum distance you must leave clear when stopping or parking before a pedestrian crossing?
questions.explanation: A minimum distance of 5 metres must be left clear before a pedestrian crossing to ensure visibility for both pedestrians and other drivers.

questions.question_text: When parking outside a built-up area, what is the minimum distance you must leave clear before a Railway Crossing?
questions.explanation: Outside a built-up area, a minimum distance of 50 metres must be maintained when parking before a Railway Crossing.

questions.question_text: What is the maximum length of time you are permitted to stop at a bus stop, provided you are not obstructing buses?
questions.explanation: You may stop at a bus stop for a maximum of 3 minutes, but only if you do not obstruct any buses.

questions.question_text: In the situation pictured, who has parked incorrectly?

options.b: The dark-coloured car in the background.

questions.explanation: The light-coloured car is parked incorrectly as it appears to be obstructing a driveway or parked against the flow of traffic on a two-way street.

questions.question_text: When is parking on the left-hand side of the road prohibited?

options.b: If it would not leave a gap of at least 3 metres between your vehicle and the lane boundary marking.
options.c: On any road within a built-up area.

questions.explanation: Parking on the left is prohibited if the remaining space between your vehicle and the lane boundary marking is less than 3 metres, as this would impede traffic flow.

questions.question_text: What is the minimum distance a vehicle must leave clear in front of traffic lights if parking the vehicle would conceal them?
questions.explanation: You must park at least 10 metres away from traffic lights if your vehicle would otherwise block other road users' view of them.

questions.question_text: A trailer without a truck may not be parked on public roads for more than what duration?
questions.explanation: An unhitched trailer is not allowed to be parked on public roads for a continuous period of more than 2 weeks.

questions.question_text: You park at 10:40 in an area allowing 2 hours of parking with a parking disc. What time must you set on the disc?
questions.explanation: When using a parking disc, you must set it to the next half-hour mark after your arrival. Arriving at 10:40 means setting the disc to 11:00.

questions.question_text: What is important to remember when children are getting in or out of a car?

options.a: Children should only use the doors on the roadway side under supervision.
options.b: Children should exit and enter on the pavement side whenever possible.
options.c: Children should wait for the driver to open the door from the outside.

questions.explanation: For safety, children should always get in or out of the car on the pavement side, away from moving traffic.

questions.question_text: After a tyre failure on the highway, how far away should you place the warning triangle?
questions.explanation: When a vehicle breaks down on a high-speed road like a highway, the warning triangle must be placed approximately 100m behind the vehicle to give oncoming traffic adequate warning.

questions.question_text: How do you secure a car with a manual gearbox against rolling away on a downhill slope?

options.a: Apply the parking brake and engage first gear or reverse gear.
options.b: Only apply the parking brake firmly.
options.c: Apply the parking brake and leave the gearbox in neutral.

questions.explanation: For maximum safety on a downhill slope, you must apply the parking brake and also engage either first gear or reverse gear to use the engine's compression to prevent rolling.

questions.question_text: Your vehicle has broken down and is being towed. Which lights must be used?

options.a: The headlights on the vehicle being towed.
options.b: The hazard warning lights on the towing vehicle only.
options.c: The hazard warning lights on both vehicles.

questions.explanation: When a vehicle is being towed, both the towing vehicle and the vehicle being towed must have their hazard warning lights switched on.

questions.question_text: A car with servo brakes has broken down due to engine damage. What is correct about its braking ability when being towed?

options.a: The brakes will not work at all and cannot be used.
options.b: The car can only achieve a slight braking effect, even with increased pedal pressure.
options.c: The brakes will function as normal without the engine running.

questions.explanation: Without the engine running, the servo-assistance for the brakes will not work. The brakes can still be applied, but they will require much more physical force on the pedal and will only have a slight effect.
